description:
Ex-pro roadie and Tour de France stage winner Dan Martin is much better known for riding uphill than down, but we heard he wanted to get into mountain biking so found the perfect challenge for him: riding one of the most treacherous World Cup DH tracks - Fort William. Coached by MTB royalty, Gee and Dan Atherton, how will he get on as he prepares for this epic challenge?

In association with @EnduraOfficial üëâ https://gcn.eu/Endura

The Global Cycling Network (GCN) is the largest online cycling channel in the world, bringing together a global community of road cyclists to celebrate everything that‚Äôs great about the world of cycling.

Our videos bring fans compelling daily content including expert tutorials, techniques, training, racing, cutting-edge bike tech, unparalleled behind the scenes event coverage, humour,  entertainment, and more.

Presented by ex-pro riders, GCN offers a uniquely qualified insight into the world of cycling, and most importantly it‚Äôs fuelled by our passionate and enthusiastic fans ‚Äì everyone who makes up the GCN community. We also bring the latest and greatest tech to your attention, showcase the best places in the world to ride and get exclusive access to events and races.

Welcome to the Global Cycling Network | Inside Cycling

title: Can A Tour De France Stage Winner Survive A Downhill MTB World Cup Track? | Part 1

description:
The Tour de France is well underway, but before it started Si headed out to Copenhagen in Denmark to spy out the hottest new bike tech the pros are using including massive chainrings, gold cassettes and chains (fist bump) and unreleased prototype bikes! 

Time Stamps: 
0:00 - Intro 
0:25 - New Pinarello Bolide F
1:19 - Ineos Tech 
2:00 - Prototype Campagnolo Wheels
2:40 - New Cube Lightning TE
3:30 - 28mm TT Tyres
4:06 - Bespoke Chainring 
4:57 - Gold Chain & Cassette
5:34 - Aero Derailleur 
7:03 - Israel Premier Tech New Look

Brought to you by the world‚Äôs biggest cycling channel, the Global Cycling Network (GCN), GCN Tech is the only channel you need for all things bike tech ‚Äì past, present and future.

Simply put, we‚Äôre obsessed with tech: we seek out and showcase the best in bikes, components, tech, accessories, upgrades and more from races and events, tech shows and product launches across the globe to bring you the best in road bike technology.

We‚Äôve also got great maintenance videos to help you get the most from your bike; pro-bike tours from all the biggest races; special features and the weekly GCN Tech Show. We also take a deeper look into the future of cycling, apps, smart tech and virtual riding.

description:
The first road stage of the Tour sees the peloton ride more than 200 km from Copenhagen to Nyborg. While the elevation of the low lying Danish countryside is unlikely to have an impact on the race, long stretches of exposed coastal roads along with the 18km crossing of the Green Belt Bridge may leave the race vulnerable to crosswind chaos.

Watch extended highlights on the GCN App üëâ gcn.eu/racetv

description:
Stage 3 sees another opportunity for the sprinters on their final day in Sardinia. The route from Cala Gonone to Olbia has barely a ripple of uphill to spoil what promises to be a glorious afternoon of cycling by the sea.

description:
The Team GB Hope Lotus racing bike is an icon of cycling. Designed for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics as a collaboration between Hope and Lotus, it is the world‚Äôs most expensive racing bike. Alex recently had the opportunity to take a close-up look when he was in Derby filming with Team GB track star Ollie Wood.

How Fast Is The World's Most Expensive Race Bike? üëâ https://youtu.be/WyVPOfs3hb4

description:
The Olympics represent not only the pinnacle of athletic perfection, but also the forefront of sport technology. The Hope Lotus track bike is the epitome of this technology, combining radical aerodynamics and an incredibly strong carbon fibre construction to create the ultimate track bike. But how much faster is it than a standard track bike? We're in Derby to find out!

description:
Since retiring from professional cycling our resident track cyclist, Manon, has taken to riding her bike more casually, swapping training rides for cafe rides. But now she's going to face one of her toughest challenges to date, cycling the full 228km of the Steamboat Gravel Race. But how will she be training for this epic race around her full time job? We partnered up with Wahoo to get her in the best shape possible on limited time!

In association with:
Wahoo Fitness üëâ @Wahoo Fitness

description:
The first maglia rosa of the 2022 Giro Donne will be decided by a straight forward, out-and-back time trial along the coast of Sardinia‚Äôs capital city, Cagliari. At just 4.8km long, there won‚Äôt be huge time gaps on stage 1, but the short and flat course will lend itself to very fast average speeds.

title: Who Will Wear Maglia Rosa After Opening TT?  | Giro Donne 2022 Stage 1 Highlights

description:
The Tour de France; three weeks of tension, excitement and drama, watching the world's best cyclists duke it out on some of the hardest mountains and fastest sprints in the world. At least that's the plan, but there's no guarantee that any Tour will be epic. A lot goes into planning the perfect race to create optimum excitement, but what exactly makes the perfect Grand Tour? Cillian Kelly takes you through his perfect recipe!
